tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 天足彦国押人命（あまたらしひこくにおしひとのみこと、生没年不詳）は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に記される皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: Amatarashihikokuni oshihito no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family (the royal family), described in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihon Shoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His name is also referred to as Ameoshitarahiko no mikoto.
His name is also referred to as Ameoshitarahiko no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His name is also referred to as Ameoshitarahiko no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 記紀によれば、孝昭天皇の皇子で、母は瀛津世襲の妹・世襲足媛命（よそたらしひめ『日本書紀』本文、『古事記』では余曽多本毘売命、日置姫）。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihon Shoki", he was a prince of the Emperor Kosho; and his mother was Yosotarashihime (this name is described in the text of the "Nihon Shoki". According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihon Shoki", he was a prince of the Emperor Kosho; and his mother was Yosotarashihime (this name is described in the text of the "Nihon Shoki".)

According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihon Shoki," he was a prince of the Emperor Kosho; and his mother was Yosotarashihime (this name is described in the text of the "Nihon Shoki"; in the "Kojiki," she is referred to as Yosotahobime no mikoto or Hiokihime).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動、同じ内容の文が2回繰り返されているため重複分を削除、「『古事記』では余曽多本毘売命、日置姫」→訳漏れのため訳出referred to as →she is referred to as
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihon Shoki," he was a prince of the Emperor Kosho; and his mother was Yosotarashihime (this name is described in the text of the "Nihon Shoki"; in the "Kojiki," she is referred to as Yosotahobime no mikoto or Hiokihime).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母弟に日本足彦国押人尊（孝安天皇）がおり、『日本書紀』本文での皇后・押媛命は天足彦國押人の娘と記述される。
sen.e: His younger maternal half-brother was Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihito no mikoto (later the Emperor Koan), whose empress Oshihime no mikoto is described as a daughter of Amatarashihikokuni oshihito in the text of the "Nihon Shoki."

His younger maternal half-brother was Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihito no mikoto (later the Emperor Koan), whose empress Oshihime no mikoto is described as a daughter of Amatarashihikokuni oshihito in the text of the "Nihon Shoki."
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: His younger maternal half-brother was Yamatotarashihiko kunioshihito no mikoto (later the Emperor Koan), whose empress Oshihime no mikoto is described as a daughter of Amatarashihikokuni oshihito in the text of the "Nihon Shoki."
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 事績は伝わらないが、『古事記』には、阿那臣・壱比韋臣・大坂臣・大宅臣（おおやけのおみ）・小野氏・柿本臣・春日氏・粟田臣・多紀臣・羽栗臣・知多臣・牟邪臣（むさのおみ）・都怒山臣・伊勢飯高君・壱師君・近江国国造（ちかつあふみ）の祖とされている。
sen.e: Although the reliability of the information is not ensured, he is described in the "Kojiki" as an ancestor of the clans of Ana no omi, Ichihii no omi, Osaka no omi, Oyake no omi, Ono uji, Kakimoto no omi, Kasuga uji, Awata no omi, Taki no omi, Haguri no omi, Chita no omi, Musa no omi, Tsunoyama no omi, Ise no itaka no kimi, Ichishi no kimi and Chikatsuafumi no kunizuko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the reliability of the information is not ensured, he is described in the "Kojiki" as an ancestor of the clans of Ana no omi, Ichihii no omi, Osaka no omi, Oyake no omi, Ono uji, Kakimoto no omi, Kasuga uji, Awata no omi, Taki no omi, Haguri no omi, Chita no omi, Musa no omi, Tsunoyama no omi, Ise no itaka no kimi, Ichishi no kimi and Chikatsuafumi no kuni no miyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、Chikatsuafumi no kunizuko→Chikatsuafumi no kuni no miyatsukoとしました。
sen.e: Although the reliability of the information is not ensured, he is described in the "Kojiki" as an ancestor of the clans of Ana no omi, Ichihii no omi, Osaka no omi, Oyake no omi, Ono uji, Kakimoto no omi, Kasuga uji, Awata no omi, Taki no omi, Haguri no omi, Chita no omi, Musa no omi, Tsunoyama no omi, Ise no itaka no kimi, Ichishi no kimi and Chikatsuafumi no kuni no miyatsuko.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には和珥氏の祖とし、『新撰姓氏録』にも同様の系譜記載がある。
sen.e: In the "Nihon Shoki," he is described as an ancestor of Wani uji (clan), and similar family tree appears in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the "Nihon Shoki," he is described as an ancestor of the Wani uji (clan), and similar family tree appears in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、Wani uji→the Wani ujiとしました。
sen.e: In the "Nihon Shoki," he is described as an ancestor of the Wani uji (clan), and similar family tree appears in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (Newly Compiled Register of Clan Names and Titles of Nobility).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: なお、子に和邇日子押人命（稚押彦命）がいる（『和邇系図』）。
sen.e: According to the "Wani Keizu" (The Family Tree of the Wani Family), his child was called Yamatohiko oshihito no mikoto (Waka oshihito no mikoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 和邇日子押人命（稚押彦命）については正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: According to the "Wani Keizu" (The Family Tree of the Wani Family), his child was called Yamatohiko oshihito no mikoto (Waka oshihito no mikoto).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正
sen.e: According to the "Wani Keizu" (The Family Tree of the Wani Family), his child was called Yamatohiko oshihito no mikoto (Waka oshihito no mikoto).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 名からして和邇氏族の宗祖的存在と言える。
sen.e: These names show the reason he is considered as the founder of the Wani family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These names show the reason he is considered as the founder of the Wani family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: These names show the reason he is considered as the founder of the Wani family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 奈良県平群町にある猪上神社、滋賀県滋賀郡志賀町の小野神社の祭神である。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Igami-jinja Shrine in Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture and Ono-jinja Shrine in Shiga-cho, Shiga-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 滋賀県滋賀郡志賀町は、現在滋賀県大津市になっています。現状では原文通りに訳しています。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Igami-jinja Shrine in Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture and Ono-jinja Shrine in Shiga-cho, Shiga County, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Shiga-gun→Shiga Countyとしました。
sen.e: He is enshrined as a deity at Igami-jinja Shrine in Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture and Ono-jinja Shrine in Shiga-cho, Shiga County, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また天理市・和爾下神社も明治初年頃は祭神としていた。
sen.e: Wanishita-jinja Shrine in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture used to enshrine him as a deity in early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 天理市に「奈良県」を補っています。不要の場合は削除願います。
sen.e: Wanishita-jinja Shrine in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture used to enshrine him as a deity in the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: in early Meiji period→in the early Meiji periodとしました。
sen.e: Wanishita-jinja Shrine in Tenri City, Nara Prefecture used to enshrine him as a deity in the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
